title: Blockchain as a Database: Immutable and Distributed
description: One-minute skill: Blockchain as a Database: Immutable and Distributed.

hook.text: What if no one owned the database, no one could edit past records, and everyone could verify every transaction?

buildup.text: Blockchain is a distributed database where records are chained together cryptographically and verified by consensus.

discovery.text: Once written, blockchain records are practically immutable. This makes them ideal for trust-sensitive applications.

punchline.text: The slowest database ever built. And for some problems, exactly the right one.
